title: Community Health Extension Worker
courseBrief: This is a programme which is aimed at producing community health workers with appropriate and adequate knowledge, skills and attitude for...
courseDetails:
This is a programme which is aimed at producing community health workers with appropriate and adequate knowledge, skills and attitude for effective delivery of health care services at the primary health care level.

This is a three(3) year intensive semester based program comprising of college/classroom theory and practical placement

At the end of this training, the Community Health Extension Worker will be able to perform the following functions:

Community-based functions

  • Explain to the community the primary health care approach of the nigerian Health System and his/her role as a member of the health team expected to link the community with the health care system
  • Carry out community mobilization for health action
  • Guide and support the Volunter Village Health workers (VVHWs)/Traditional Birth Attendants (TBAs) and Junior Community Health Extension workers (JCHEWs) to initiate preliminary contact with the leaders
  • Familiarize self with target population and health services within the community

Clinic-based functions

  • Organize and run Integrated Primary Health Care services (where Community Health Officer is not available) based on their skills and competence
  • Collect and collate monitoring and evaluation data for the National Health Management Information System (NHMIS) from the community and health facility and forward to the ward level
  • Carry out with Community Health Officer (where available) the day-to-day administration of health services in the target population

Training Funtions

  • Organize and run Integrated Primary Health Care Services (where Community Health Officer is not available) based on their skills and competence. These services are listed in the Nigerian National Health Plan

title: Medical Laboratory Science
courseBrief:
This is a programme which is aimed at training competent clinical laboratory personnel to
 meet present and projected service needs in...
courseDetails:
This is a programme which is aimed at training competent clinical laboratory personnel to meet present and projected service needs in primary and secondary health care services.

This is a three(3) year intensive semester based program with a strong practical medical laboratory exposure component.

At the end of this training, the Medical Laboratory Technician will:

  • Have acquired knowledge that will enable him/her to work under the supervision of qualified Medical Laboratory Scientist
  • Be able to handle, proccess and perform simple systematic analysis of routine specimens he/she recieves
  • appreciate the importance of his/her role in the chain of activity within the diagnostic laboratory
  • Be fully competent in planning, organizing the workflow and proper utilization of space, instrumentation and resources in ensuring the production of accurate and reliable results for effective diagnosis

Students who successfully complete this programme are usually able to:

  • Seek employment in a clinical laboratory setting with the ability to perform routine laboratory procedures with accuracy and precision
  • Recognize normal and abnormal test results and take necessary action with critical values
  • Perform and interpret basic quality control procedures
  • Operate and perform basic maintenance and troubleshooting of laboratory equipment
  • Recognize and adhere to safety policies and practices
  • demonstrate sound work ethics in interactions with patients, co-workers and othr personnel

title: Health Promotion Education
courseBrief: This is a programme which is aimed at producing professionals who will provide appropriate Health Promotion and Education services at...
courseDetails:
health Promotion and Education play a vital role in disease prevention and control. Health Education is the first component of Primary Health Care (PHC) and it cuts accross all other components of PHC. This programme is aimed at producing professionals who will provide appropriate Health Promotion and Education services at the health facilities, schools, workplaces and the community at large.

This is a two(2) year intensive semester based program and at the end of this training, the health Promotion Educator will:

  • Highly knowledgeable in the principles and practice of Health Promotion and Education
  • Skilled in planning, implementing and evaluating Health Promotion and Education (HPE) programmes at the health facilities, schools, work places and community levels
  • improved skill of communication, counseling and advocacy for HPE programmes

title: Health Information Management
courseBrief: This is a programme which is aimed at producing graduands who have great knowledge and skills to assist in planning, collating...
courseDetails:
This is a programme which is aimed at producing graduands who have great knowledge and skills to assist in planning, collating, organizing, disseminating, monitoring and managing vital information required at the Primary Health Care and state levels in order to ensure effective and comprehensive health care delivery

This is a three(3) year intensive semester based program, including supervised clinical work experience (or SIWES), and at the end of this training, the diplomate will be knowlegeable and skilled enough to:

  • Assist in planning and organizing health information services in health care delivery system
  • Organise and controll health records, under supervision, in health and medical establishments
  • Collect, store, retrieve and preserve health information
  • Collate, analyse and present health statistical data under supervision
  • participate in planning quality control, evaluation, researches in health care delivery system and other relevant committees in defining standards for health information

title: Environmental Health Technician
courseBrief: This is a professional Diploma programme which is aimed at poducing practitioners who can assist Environmental Health officers and...
courseDetails:
This is a professional Diploma programme which is aimed at poducing practitioners who can assist Environmental Health officers and Technologist in delivering Environmental Health Services in homes, communities and workplaces with more practice based approaches. Environmental health care forms the bedrock of Public Health services and remains a very important component of Primary Health care in any country.

This is a three(3) year intensive semester based program comprising of college/classroom theory, practical and Supervised Industrial Work Experience Scheme (SIWES) and at the end of this training, the Environmental Health Technician will be able to:

  • Identify hazards associated with each environment
  • Identify the factors for quantifying the level of risks associated with each hazard
  • Determine measures to mitigate and control the risk identified
  • Explain global environmental challanges and their impact on the local environment
  • Relate apprioprately and effectively with the public and other professionals in the management of the environment
  • Guide trainees on the field appreciation of environmental health conditions
  • Demonstrate apprioprate scientific techniques to mitigate the environmental health risks identified
